name: Captain Dunkin's Scottish Ale
description: Before being incarcerated for the siege of Charleston, Scottish pirate George Dunkin toasted his shipmates with a pint of Scottish ale. This sweet, malty ale is smoky, peaty, with hints of caramel and roasted coffee

style.name: Scottish-Style Light Ale
style.description: Scottish light ales are light bodied. Little bitterness is perceived, and hop flavor or aroma should not be perceived. Despite its lightness, Scottish light ale will have a degree of malty, caramel-like, soft and chewy character. Yeast characters such as diacetyl (butterscotch) and sulfuriness are acceptable at very low levels. The color will range from golden amber to deep brown Bottled versions of this traditional draft beer may contain higher amounts of carbon dioxide than is typical for mildly carbonated draft versions. Chill haze is acceptable at low temperatures. Though there is little evidence suggesting that traditionally made Scottishstyle light ales exhibited peat smoke character, the current marketplace offers many Scottish-style light ales with peat or smoke character present at low to medium levels. Thus a peaty/smoky character may be evident at low levels (ales with medium or higher smoke character would be considered a smoke flavored beer and considered in another category). Scottish-style light ales may be split into two subcategories: Traditional (no smoke character) and Peated (low level of peat smoke character).

breweries.name: Trap Rock Restaurant and Brewery
breweries.description: Trap Rock Restaurant & Brewery opened its doors 1997 and combines seasonal craft brews with seasonal, American food. Designed by Morris Nathanson, Trap Rock Restaurant offers a working microbrewery and a comfortable European ski lodge atmosphere.

name: CB's MacBubba
description:
Meet “MacBubba”. This BIG, good ol’ boy is Scottish to the core. He is bold, but absolutely loveable. Once you get to know MacBubba, you won’t know how you went anywhere without him. This Scotch Ale has a subtle smoky undertone not found in many other beers. Starting with a beautiful dark-amber color it has a nice rich aroma that follows with a full bodied caramel flavor. You will note a
slight “peaty” character in the finish, derived from the addition of some of the finest Peated Malt from Scotland. We think you will find this Scotch Ale very easy to enjoy while still bold enough to stand up to a harsh winter chill.
foodPairings: A perfect match with smoked meats, strong cheeses, and desserts. Also quite effective as a braising ale or in used in soups.

available.name: Seasonal
available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.

breweries.name: Custom Brewcrafters, Inc.
breweries.description:
Custom BrewCrafters introduced to the market in 1997 an innovative micro-brewing concept in which they have partnered with dozens of local restaurant and tavern owners in offering unique signature craft-brews custom designed for each establishment.

In addition to adding this new dimension to the Western New York beer market, Custom BrewCrafters opened a tasting room and gift shop at the brewery in Honeoye Falls, where we introduce the public to the many unique custom brews as well as educate them on craft beer and microbrewing.

name: Corne de Brume
description:
Corne de Brume (The Air Horn) is a Scotch ale at 9.0% alcohol. In a deep brown with hints of ruby, she dons a mocha mousse aspects. This is the mouth Air Horn reveals its depth. A wall of caramelized flavor stands before us and surrounds us warmly language. This dance caramelized and lascivious binds with bitterness deaf to form a waltz which combines wild fruits and heady malt. Some time later, the bitterness release its grip on our taste buds to slowly bring us back to reality.
Beer aging potential

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

breweries.name: A l'abri de la Tempête
breweries.description:
Located in the Îles de la Madeleine , L'Etang-du-Nord in a former fish processing plant, the microbrewery A l'abri de la Tempête (Shelter From The Storm) enjoys a prime location on the seafront, with breathtaking views to the west. Before you go to relax on the beach or after a busy day of sand and salt water, take a refreshing break in our tasting room.

A l'abri de la Tempête promotes the use of local raw materials in the design of their beers. That began with the transformation of barley malt, it continues its momentum with the harvest of flowers, seaweed and fresh herbs. The use of local resources is a guarantee of authenticity and freshness that contributes to the design of unique beers and sleek.

style.name: Scottish-Style Light Ale

name: Dark Island
description:
Dark Island is an iconic beer: a standard-bearer for traditional Scottish ales. In cask, this beer has twice won CAMRA's Champion Beer of Scotland. On the nose, this dark beer offers bitter chocolate, figs, toffee and hints of fruit.

On the palate, this resolves into beautiful, silky-smooth, coffee-and-chocolate flavours, followed by figs, dates and dried fruits, with a very appealing, lingering aftertaste of fruits and hop bitterness.

name: Doonright Scottish Ale
description:
Double boiled to caramelize proteins that add complexity to the malt flavor
and subtle smokiness, very smooth.

breweries.name: Four Day Ray Brewing
breweries.description:
A soft, easy life is not worth living. Neither is a life spent nose to the grindstone without a cold beer at the end of the day to enjoy the fruit of your labors.
We dare to be great in industry and revelry alike. We’ll never water down or sacrifice flavor for fashion, and we hold every dish from our scratch kitchen to the same high standard.

Our name recalls our Nickel Plate District heritage, drawn from the nickname for a railroad employee who called off work one day a week. Like those laborers of yesteryear, we strive mightily that we may celebrate heartily.

They made Fishers a place to live. We’ll make Fishers a place to love—putting in the work to push our city forward and knocking back a pint to celebrate a job well done.

name: Dram Tree Scottish Ale
description: Our House specialty. Dark but smooth, maly and semi-sweet, with caramel tones and a slight mocha finish. Mahogany body with ruby highlights. So smooth, this beer is constantly turning regular light-beer drinkers to the dark side. Pale, Munich, Chocolate and Caramel malts make up the backbone of this Ale. Challenger and EKG hops are used sparingly.
foodPairings: Bacon, Scottish Ale Brew-Bq Sauce Ribs, Jim Beam Sirloin Steak

breweries.name: Front Street Brewery
breweries.description:
Located in Historic Downtown, the Front Street Brewery is Wilmington’s only Restaurant with its own Brewery. Our staff takes pride in offering fresh modern American cuisine, ranging from gourmet burgers to fine entrees and everything in between, at a reasonable price.

Front Street Brewery focuses on traditional beers as well as stretching the limits from time to time with various oak aged beers, sours and experimental styles throughout the year.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation: Open daily for lunch, dinner and late night.

breweries.description: People make our beer great. We handcraft fresh, locally made beer in Indiana. Our small batch brewing facility and staff believes in quality and consistency throughout each of our craft beer products and services.

breweries.name: MadTree Brewing Company
breweries.description:
MadTree Brewing Company was started by three self-proclaimed “maniac” homebrewers and aspiring entrepreneurs who believe strongly in the creation of beers that stand up to the best craft brews across the country.
Along with that vision they put their own “mad twists” on their creations. The MadTree approach is simple – create high quality beer, educate the consumer, run a responsible business, and support the local communities.
MadTree engages local artists and craftspeople for their marketing materials, can designs, tap handles and furniture. Many of these efforts have received local and national recognition.

HIGHLIGHTS
- The trio quit their corporate jobs in 2012/2013 and in January 2013 they brewed their first commercial batch.
- In April they opened their taproom and became the first modern craft brewery to can their beer in the state of Ohio.
- Draft Magazine rated PsycHOPathy IPA a 97/100, the second best score for an IPA reviewed by Draft Magazine.
- PsycHOPathy IPA was named as one of the “Six New Craft Can Designs That Belong in an Art Gallery” by craftcans.com

name: Fiddlin' Willies Scottish Ale
description: Wonderfully malty ale, with a dark reddish-brown color.  Caramalt and Chocolate malts dominate the flavor, with a hint of smokiness.  The East Kent Goldings hops are few in this brew, just enough for a slight balance. Toffee and chocolate flavors are evident.  Great for the malt lover in all of us.

name: Fox Trotter Scottish Ale
description: Named after the state horse of Missouri, a combination of three different Crystal malts round out this medium-bodied Scottish-style ale. Northern Brewer and English Fuggle hops balance the light yet complex malt character leaving a hint of chocolate malt tones uncovered.

breweries.name: Stockyards Brewing Co.
breweries.description: A new production brewery and tap room located in the historic Stockyards District of Kansas City's West Bottoms

name: Fresh Spring
description: Refreshing light ale, its colour is likened to daffodils. Brewed with a nice blend of malted barley with locally grown Fuggles hops for a gentle hop aroma and flavour. At 4.0% abv it is very drinkable.

breweries.name: Hogs Back Brewery
breweries.description: The Hogs Back Brewery is an independent brewery based in Tongham, Surrey. Our flagship real ale, ‘TEA’ (Traditional English Ale), has proved to be a favourite of cask conditioned ale drinkers throughout the UK and is the proud winner of many awards.

name: Half Kilt
description: Cleanly malty with a drying finish. It has a relatively sweet palate that finishes dry with a touch of caramelizatian from the kettle. One of the original session beers.

style.description: Scottish light ales are light bodied. Little bitterness is perceived, and hop flavor or aroma should not be perceived. breweries.name: Union Brewing Company
breweries.description: At Union Brewing Company, our artisan ales are hand crafted two barrels at a time using time honored traditions, natural ingredients and traditional methods. Our beers are never filtered or force carbonated. They condition and carbonate naturally in casks and are hand drawn by authentic beer engines at the perfect drinking temperature to maximize all the flavors. (No, they are not warm!) We really like beer, and we love cask conditioned real ales. We think you will too!

locations.hoursOfOperation:
Mon - Thu: 4:00 pm - 11:00 pm
Fri: 3:00 pm - 1:00 am
Sat: 12:00 pm - 1:00 am
Sun: 12:00 pm - 9:00 pm

style.name: British-Style Barley Wine Ale
style.description: British-style barley wines range from tawny copper to dark brown in color and have a full body and high residual malty sweetness. Complexity of alcohols and fruity-ester characters are often high and counterbalanced by the perception of low to medium bitterness and extraordinary alcohol content. Hop aroma and flavor may be minimal to medium. English type hops are often used but not necessary for this style. Low levels of diacetyl may be acceptable. Caramel and some characters indicating oxidation, such as vinous (sometimes sherry-like) aromas and/or flavors, may be considered positive. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.

style.name: British-Style Barley Wine Ale
style.description: British-style barley wines range from tawny copper to dark brown in color and have a full body and high residual malty sweetness. Complexity of alcohols and fruity-ester characters are often high and counterbalanced by the perception of low to medium bitterness and extraordinary alcohol content. Hop aroma and flavor may be minimal to medium. English type hops are often used but not necessary for this style. Low levels of diacetyl may be acceptable. Caramel and some characters indicating oxidation, such as vinous (sometimes sherry-like) aromas and/or flavors, may be considered positive. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.

breweries.name: Sun King Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Sun King Brewing Company is an Indianapolis-based craft brewery with a focus on continually creating traditional seasonal and unique specialty beers. 

Sun King rolled its first keg of beer out the door in July 2009 and since that time has grown into the second largest brewery in Indiana, producing over 27,000 barrels of beer in 2014 while selling all of it in Indiana. Sun King's beers have been awarded multiple medals at the Great American Beer Festival and World Beer Cup.

Located in a downtown Indianapolis warehouse, Sun King was the first full-scale production brewery in Indianapolis since 1948. Sun King beer can be enjoyed at fine bars/restaurants and liquor stores throughout Indiana or in their Tasting Room, located in the brewery at 135 N. College Avenue.

Hop aroma and flavor may be minimal to medium. English type hops are often used but not necessary for this style. Low levels of diacetyl may be acceptable. Caramel and some characters indicating oxidation, such as vinous (sometimes sherry-like) aromas and/or flavors, may be considered positive. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.

breweries.name: Rockford Brewing Company
breweries.description: RBC produces world class beers using traditional and innovative brewing techniques and ingredients. As a company, we strive to create unique beers with influences from countries around the world including the United States, Belgium, Germany, the United Kingdom, and the newest emerging craft beer location that has the world watching; Michigan. Part of our niche is working closely with West Michigan farmers and local ingredients on a seasonal basis. We love to incorporate West Michigan agricultural products into our offerings!

style.name: British-Style Barley Wine Ale
style.description: British-style barley wines range from tawny copper to dark brown in color and have a full body and high residual malty sweetness. Complexity of alcohols and fruity-ester characters are often high and counterbalanced by the perception of low to medium bitterness and extraordinary alcohol content. Hop aroma and flavor may be minimal to medium. English type hops are often used but not necessary for this style. Low levels of diacetyl may be acceptable. Caramel and some characters indicating oxidation, such as vinous (sometimes sherry-like) aromas and/or flavors, may be considered positive. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.

breweries.name: Mikkeller
breweries.description:
The story of Mikkeller is the story of two homebrewers that in a few years went from hobby brewing in the kitchen to national and international recognition.

Since the summer of 2007, Mikkel Borg Bjergsø, has run Mikkeller on his own. Mikkel is a gipsy-brewer, who brews at different breweries in Denmark, around Europe and the United States.

name: Bigfoot
description: Our award-winning barleywine boasts a dense, fruity bouquet, an intense flavor palate and a deep reddish-brown color. Its big maltiness is superbly balanced by a wonderfully bittersweet hoppiness.

style.name: British-Style Barley Wine Ale
style.description: British-style barley wines range from tawny copper to dark brown in color and have a full body and high residual malty sweetness. Complexity of alcohols and fruity-ester characters are often high and counterbalanced by the perception of low to medium bitterness and extraordinary alcohol content. Hop aroma and flavor may be minimal to medium. English type hops are often used but not necessary for this style. Low levels of diacetyl may be acceptable. Caramel and some characters indicating oxidation, such as vinous (sometimes sherry-like) aromas and/or flavors, may be considered positive. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.

breweries.name: Sierra Nevada Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The Sierra Nevada Brewing Company was established in 1980 by homebrewers Ken Grossman and Paul Camusi. Camusi retired in 1998 and sold his share in the company to Grossman.

Located in Chico, California, Sierra Nevada Brewing is one of the most popular craft breweries currently operating in the United States. Its Pale Ale is world renowned, and the brewery produces almost 700,000 barrels of beer per year. Sierra Nevada's Pale Ale is the second best-selling craft beer in the United States, behind the Boston Beer Company's Samuel Adams Boston Lager.

Sierra Nevada's specialty brews include the winter seasonal Celebration, which is similar to the pale ale, but hoppier; and Summerfest, a lager which is citrusy and sunny.

name: Billionaire
description: There are 1011 billionaires on planet Earth as of this writing. We guess that most of you, like all of us here at Clown Shoes, aren't even close to being on that list and yet dream, every now and then, billionaire dreams. Our fourth anniversary beer was crafted to make you feel wealthy: a sweet, rich and heavily malted Barley Wine Ale brewed with English yeast then aged in European Cognac barrels.

style.name: British-Style Barley Wine Ale
style.description: British-style barley wines range from tawny copper to dark brown in color and have a full body and high residual malty sweetness. Complexity of alcohols and fruity-ester characters are often high and counterbalanced by the perception of low to medium bitterness and extraordinary alcohol content. Hop aroma and flavor may be minimal to medium. English type hops are often used but not necessary for this style. Low levels of diacetyl may be acceptable. Caramel and some characters indicating oxidation, such as vinous (sometimes sherry-like) aromas and/or flavors, may be considered positive. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.

breweries.name: Clown Shoes Beer
breweries.description:
Founded in December 2009 by beer lovers trying to make work fun again, Clown Shoes has been redefining what craft beer should be. We strive to add our own little creative twists on under-represented styles and styles in need of change.

Our mission now is to produce beer without pretension while being free and a little crazy.

name: Bishopsgate
description: Barleywines were originally brewed to replace French wines in the cellars of the most discerning British drinkers. An abundance of malted barley gives Bishopsgate a rich complexity, starting with a floral nose and ending with a full-bodied toffee finish. These intense flavors are aged for sixty days and, if cellared, will continue to mingle and harmonize for years.

style.name: British-Style Barley Wine Ale
style.description: British-style barley wines range from tawny copper to dark brown in color and have a full body and high residual malty sweetness. Complexity of alcohols and fruity-ester characters are often high and counterbalanced by the perception of low to medium bitterness and extraordinary alcohol content. Hop aroma and flavor may be minimal to medium. English type hops are often used but not necessary for this style. Low levels of diacetyl may be acceptable. Caramel and some characters indicating oxidation, such as vinous (sometimes sherry-like) aromas and/or flavors, may be considered positive. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.

breweries.name: Strange Land Brewery
breweries.description: Our story is not unlike many a beer journeyman before us—we’re intoxicated with the mystery of fermentation, the possibilities of taste, and chasing after unexplored horizons. Our goal is simply to make beer —

style.name: British-Style Barley Wine Ale
style.description: British-style barley wines range from tawny copper to dark brown in color and have a full body and high residual malty sweetness. Complexity of alcohols and fruity-ester characters are often high and counterbalanced by the perception of low to medium bitterness and extraordinary alcohol content. Hop aroma and flavor may be minimal to medium. English type hops are often used but not necessary for this style. Low levels of diacetyl may be acceptable. Caramel and some characters indicating oxidation, such as vinous (sometimes sherry-like) aromas and/or flavors, may be considered positive. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.

breweries.name: Clown Shoes Beer
breweries.description:
Founded in December 2009 by beer lovers trying to make work fun again, Clown Shoes has been redefining what craft beer should be. We strive to add our own little creative twists on under-represented styles and styles in need of change.

Our mission now is to produce beer without pretension while being free and a little crazy.

style.name: British-Style Barley Wine Ale
style.description: British-style barley wines range from tawny copper to dark brown in color and have a full body and high residual malty sweetness. Complexity of alcohols and fruity-ester characters are often high and counterbalanced by the perception of low to medium bitterness and extraordinary alcohol content. Hop aroma and flavor may be minimal to medium. English type hops are often used but not necessary for this style. Low levels of diacetyl may be acceptable. Caramel and some characters indicating oxidation, such as vinous (sometimes sherry-like) aromas and/or flavors, may be considered positive. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.

breweries.name: Brouwerij de Molen
breweries.description: Our brewery is world-famous for our large variety of (imperial) stouts, ales and smoked ales. We want to make good quality beer with respect for people and the environment.

name: Bourbon Barleywine
description: A sipping beer to the core, Barleywine by itself is a traditional British digestif. After months of maturation in Bourbon barrels, our barleywine mellows thoroughly, with a luxuriously rich mouthfeel and a soft, rounded finish. Caramel malts shine through on this copper hued ale with hints of vanillin imparted by the toasted oak barrels, making Bourbon Barleywine a decadent accompaniment to sweets, or a dessert all by itself.
foodPairings: Flaky, crusty desserts, rich blue vein cheeses and hearty stews.

style.name: British-Style Barley Wine Ale
style.description: British-style barley wines range from tawny copper to dark brown in color and have a full body and high residual malty sweetness. Complexity of alcohols and fruity-ester characters are often high and counterbalanced by the perception of low to medium bitterness and extraordinary alcohol content. Hop aroma and flavor may be minimal to medium. English type hops are often used but not necessary for this style. Low levels of diacetyl may be acceptable. Caramel and some characters indicating oxidation, such as vinous (sometimes sherry-like) aromas and/or flavors, may be considered positive. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.

breweries.name: Hardywood Park Craft Brewery
breweries.description: Hardywood Park Craft Brewery is proud to be a member of the thriving craft beer scene in Richmond, VA.  Located in Richmond’s historic German brewing district, Hardywood features a 20 barrel brewing system, public taproom and outdoor beer garden, and a private event taproom.  Join us during public taproom hours, Wednesday through Sunday, and enjoy free live music, bocce ball, corn hole, local food trucks, craft fairs and brewery tours in addition to our award winning craft beer, brewed in the heart of Richmond.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
WED-FRI: 4-9PM
SAT: 2-9PM
SUN: 12-6PM 
visit www.hardywood.com/tasting-room for details.

name: Bourbon Barrel Aged Chocolate Barleywine
description: This 13.1% full-bodied Barleywine carries the flavors of toffee, caramel and dark Oaxacan chocolate alongside notes of vanilla and oak, aged in Woodford Reserve bourbon barrels.

style.name: British-Style Barley Wine Ale
style.description: British-style barley wines range from tawny copper to dark brown in color and have a full body and high residual malty sweetness. Complexity of alcohols and fruity-ester characters are often high and counterbalanced by the perception of low to medium bitterness and extraordinary alcohol content. Hop aroma and flavor may be minimal to medium. English type hops are often used but not necessary for this style. Low levels of diacetyl may be acceptable. Caramel and some characters indicating oxidation, such as vinous (sometimes sherry-like) aromas and/or flavors, may be considered positive. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.

breweries.name: Moody Tongue Brewing Company
breweries.description: Moody Tongue Brewery opened in 2014 under the direction of acclaimed brewmaster Jared Rouben. Moody Tongue, a nickname for a guest with a discerning palate, features “culinary brewing,” Rouben’s original approach that combines the worlds of brewing and cooking through the application of a chef's mindset to the brewing process. Classically trained at the Culinary Institute of America in New York, Rouben worked in lauded Michelin-starred kitchens such as the Martini House in Napa, CA, and Thomas Keller’s Per Se in New York City before moving to Chicago to pursue a career in brewing. During the fall of 2016, Moody Tongue introduced a tasting room to its brewery in the Pilsen neighborhood of Chicago, serving year-round and limited-release beers in an intimate mid-century modern atmosphere with Michelin-minded service. The Tasting Room is open Thursday from 5 p.m. to 11 p.m.; Friday from 5 p.m. to 12 a.m.; Saturday from 12 p.m. to 12 a.m.; Sunday from 12 p.m. to 9 p.m.; and Monday from 5 p.m. to 10 p.m. The Tasting Room is closed Tuesday and Wednesday.

name: Brawler
description:
PUGILIST STYLE ALE
The most approachable of our ales, Brawler is malt forward and delicately hopped for a knockout flavor. Its smooth character, hints of caramel and toast, and remarkable drinkability define this ruby colored brew as a true session ale. Perfect for when you want to go a few rounds.

AWARDS 
Silver Medal in the English Mild category at the 2013 Great American Beer Festival
foodPairings: Brawler's bready essence and luscious malts lend a sweetness that brings out flavors in margherita pizza and low and slow BBQ. Its lower alcohol content makes it a great partner for spicier dishes. It also goes great with the company of good friends.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

style.name: English-Style Dark Mild Ale
style.description: English dark mild ales range from deep copper to dark brown (often with a red tint) in color. Malt flavor and caramel are part of the flavor and aroma profile while, licorice and roast malt tones may sometimes contribute to the flavor and aroma profile. Body should be low-medium to medium. These beers have very little hop flavor or aroma. Very low diacetyl flavors may be appropriate in this low-alcohol beer. Fruity-ester level is very low.

breweries.name: Yards Brewing Company
breweries.description:
In 1988, two cash-strapped collegiate wrestlers realized that they could sustain their thirst for quality beer without spending their modest savings at the local liquor store by brewing beer themselves. So began the friendship of Tom Kehoe and Jon Bovit.

As they made their way through college they continued to experiment with homebrewing and formulating new recipes. Proud of their product, they were eager to share it with friends. An instant favorite, it wasn't long until they realized their modest homebrewing operation wasn't going to be enough to satisfy the growing demand.

During the early 1990s, many breweries opened, and craft brewing started to gain popularity. Working in a small English-style brewery in Western Maryland, Tom Kehoe and Jon Bovit decided to take matters into their own hands, and in 1994, they founded Yards Brewing Company.

name: Brewer’s Dark
description: This dark-coloured beer is smooth, well-rounded and light to drink. It has enticingly sweet undertones of liquorice and chocolate, and a full, malty aftertaste. Always a favourite with cask ale fanatics. This beer has also won a CAMRA gold award, so we’re confident about its quality. First brewed in 1982.

name: British Ugly
description: A true session beer with a drinkable palate overflowing with biscuit and roasty aromas, and a big toasted character reminiscent of a fresh baked hard pretzel.

These beers have very little hop flavor or aroma. Very low diacetyl flavors may be appropriate in this low-alcohol beer. Fruity-ester level is very low.

breweries.name: 350 Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The 350 Brewing Company has spawned from the ashes of our failed Collegiate careers at Northern Illinois University. Let me explain. 350 Augusta Ave. was our address in Dekalb, IL. At the time, your founders Todd and Erik spent more time on projects like way below average punk rock bands in the attic, and a Hardcore Wrestling Federation called WCVF (this took place in our kitchen), instead of focusing on classes like Humanities 227 in DuSable Hall. I mean, have you ever choke slammed one of your best friends into an oven pre-heated to "550 degrees"? Well i have, and that was just a random Wednesday night. This raw energy (stupidity) and creativity is what eventually drew us to the Craft Beer scene. That’s what craft beer is…a creative and fresh twist on a beverage that has been mass produced and shoved down our throats for much too long (carefully stepping down from soapbox). Why not name our Brewery after the point in our life when we were most creative? Well…..we did. It was during these times we were also introduced to good, quality beer.

Once NIU had enough of our shenanigans, Erik went on to continue his education while I submerged myself into the cesspool known as corporate America. I feel dirty just talking about it. Over the last decade, my soul has been slowly rotting and exiting my body so there was a need for this creative juice to be squeezed once again. Since wrestling and punk rock was now out of the question, brewing beer quickly became that much needed release from the Groundhog Day that had become the norm for us. Erik like most homebrewers started out brewing with extract several years ago and quickly rose to the challenge of all-grain batches. Erik, the 350 Head brewer, has been very successful when entering brewing competitions walking away with multiple awards for his Porter and Patersbier. Myself on the other hand have had a love for flavorful craft beer for many moons, and once I learned of Erik’s brewing expertise years ago, I too became emerged in this brewing lifestyle. It was a match made in heaven. Erik brewed awesome beer, and I was awesome at drinking and sharing that beer!!! 

From that point on things just sort of clicked and for the last 2 years Erik and I have been researching and concocting this master plan of opening a brewery. The time has come. We want all of you to enjoy this journey with us. Tinley Park has always been our #1 choice for the 350 Brewing Company. Downtown Tinley Park embodies the spirit of 350. With great electricity in the downtown area, coupled with an amazing artistic feel, will definitely pair well with our vision of always making sure a visit to our brewery is an interesting experience. We feel Tinley Park is ready for a neighborhood brewery. It really was an easy decision based on Tinley Park’s sense of community and passion for supporting local products.

We are looking forward to joining the family of incredible Illinois Brewers. We should all thank our lucky stars that we live in a state with such high quality Breweries.

style.name: English-Style Dark Mild Ale
style.description: English dark mild ales range from deep copper to dark brown (often with a red tint) in color. Malt flavor and caramel are part of the flavor and aroma profile while, licorice and roast malt tones may sometimes contribute to the flavor and aroma profile. Body should be low-medium to medium. These beers have very little hop flavor or aroma. Very low diacetyl flavors may be appropriate in this low-alcohol beer. Fruity-ester level is very low.

breweries.name: Scratchtown Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Scratchtown Brewing Company is a start-up craft brewery in Ord, Nebraska. We are currently constructing a new facility in downtown Ord. We expect to be operational by mid-year 2013.

Our passion is making and drinking great beer. Our mission in Central Nebraska, like Central Europe, is to craft a local beer culture that celebrates the wonderful variety of beers and build a viable industry in rural Nebraska.

In Ord, we are blessed to live among some of the most fertile land in the world, with access to some of the freshest, cleanest water on the planet - the Ogalala Aquifer. Our climate helps make our home an ideal brewers paradise, much like the old country.

We're fond of the Bohemian and Polish heritage that built Ord and the Loup Valley. We brew a wide variety of beer, but will always brew with a nod to the heritage of our home.

style.name: English-Style Dark Mild Ale
style.description: English dark mild ales range from deep copper to dark brown (often with a red tint) in color. Malt flavor and caramel are part of the flavor and aroma profile while, licorice and roast malt tones may sometimes contribute to the flavor and aroma profile. Body should be low-medium to medium. These beers have very little hop flavor or aroma. Very low diacetyl flavors may be appropriate in this low-alcohol beer. Fruity-ester level is very low.

name: Cafe a l’Orange
description: English mild with coffee and orange

style.name: English-Style Dark Mild Ale
style.description: English dark mild ales range from deep copper to dark brown (often with a red tint) in color. Malt flavor and caramel are part of the flavor and aroma profile while, licorice and roast malt tones may sometimes contribute to the flavor and aroma profile. Body should be low-medium to medium. These beers have very little hop flavor or aroma. Very low diacetyl flavors may be appropriate in this low-alcohol beer. Fruity-ester level is very low.

breweries.name: Brewery Ferment
breweries.description:
Ferment is an inviting, casual, neighborhood brewery that is truly all about the beer. We blend traditional styles and techniques with a new world approach to brewing, influenced by traditions throughout the world while remaining true to Northern Michigan.

We believe in emphasizing our Midwestern roots
This area has ample farmland, and hops grow perfectly here. We aim to make the most of what local growers have to offer, brewing with Northern Michigan ingredients as much as possible. We also have a small menu of unique bar snacks and outside food is welcome. We have five flagship beers on draft along with rotating specialties and bottled conditioned beers. Stop in, have a pint and you will notice the local difference.

name: Canterbury Dark Mild Lager
description:
Specialty Lager: Caramel bodied with delicate aroma hops and a pleasant finish
Canada’s first copper-coloured lager, Canterbury Dark Mild is brewed with the finest hops, yeast and most importantly, two-row malted barley. This distinctive beer is an homage to the finest of British brews and a favourite of those want mouth-filling flavour when they’re in the pub or at home.

Canterbury features a smooth, mature taste to complement its bold, rich colour while retaining a lager’s traditional, fresh finish. This classically brewed beer is a tad sweeter than its pale pilsner cousins and a natural complement to a good Irish Stew or other full-bodied fare. The ideal match is most pub grub like fish and chips or steak and kidney pie

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

style.name: English-Style Dark Mild Ale
style.description: English dark mild ales range from deep copper to dark brown (often with a red tint) in color. Malt flavor and caramel are part of the flavor and aroma profile while, licorice and roast malt tones may sometimes contribute to the flavor and aroma profile. Body should be low-medium to medium. These beers have very little hop flavor or aroma. Very low diacetyl flavors may be appropriate in this low-alcohol beer. Fruity-ester level is very low.

breweries.name: Pacific Western Brewery
breweries.description:
Canada’s longest running, British Columbian-owned brewery was established in 1957 on a fresh water spring in Prince George, BC. Originally named Caribou Brewing, Pacific Western Brewing Company (PWB) has had seven owners over it's storied past and achieved many milestones. Including, being the first Canadian brewer to export to mainland China in 1991 and then to Russia in 1996. Along the way these achievements have shaped the BC beer backbone for over fifty years.

PWB Accomplishments

2005 - First Canadian Gold Medal Winner, Industry International Awards in Munich
2003 - First ISO 9001 Certified Brewery in North America
1997 - First Certified Organic Lager Beer in Canada
1996 - First North American Brewery Certified to ISO 9002
1996 - First Lager and Lime Beer
1995 - First Malted Herb Beer
1993 - First Ice Beer in Canada
1988 - First Dry Beer in Canada
1983 - First Brewery Operated Beer Store in BC
1982 - First Dark Mild Beer in Canada
1969 - First Malt Liquor in Canada
1965 - First Canned Beer in BC

style.name: English-Style Dark Mild Ale
style.description: English dark mild ales range from deep copper to dark brown (often with a red tint) in color. Malt flavor and caramel are part of the flavor and aroma profile while, licorice and roast malt tones may sometimes contribute to the flavor and aroma profile. Body should be low-medium to medium. These beers have very little hop flavor or aroma. Very low diacetyl flavors may be appropriate in this low-alcohol beer. Fruity-ester level is very low.

breweries.name: Four Corners Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The story of Four Corners Brewing Co. is simple. We’re Dallas natives and we’re craft beer fans. Most importantly, we are a dedicated team of brewers with the goal of offering handcrafted beers that pair well with the food, music, art and culture in our hometown. Refreshing and soulful, it’s what we call “local flavor” and we proudly raise a glass to that! 

Flavorful and satisfying 
“All Day” Ales…that’s what we’re brewing.

name: Let's Get Weird - Side Trail Series
nameDisplay: Let's Get Weird - Side Trail Series
description: The initial aroma provides hints of pear and apple with a light spiciness complimented by delicate, coffee, berry, and chocolate notes. The flavor is that of slightly sweet creamy chocolate and light roasted malt with background notes of fresh fruit and the pleasant, berry-like tartness of black currants.

style.name: Dark American-Belgo-Style Ale
style.description: These beers must portray the unique characters imparted by yeasts typically used in fruity and big Belgian-Style ales - These beers are not traditional Belgian styles which are already defined. They are unique beers unto themselves. Notes of banana, berry, apple, sometimes coriander spice-like and/or smoky-phenolic characters should be portrayed with balance of hops and malt character when fermented with such yeast. Hop aroma, flavor and bitterness not usually found in the base style, can be medium to very high and must show the characters of American hop varieties. Dark color falls in the deep amber/brown to black range. Roasted malts or barley may have a range of character from subtle to robust, and should be reflected in the overall character and balance of the beer. Esters should be at medium to high levels. Diacetyl should not be evident. Chill haze may be evident. Sulfurlike yeast character should be absent. No Brettanomyces character should be present. An ale which exhibits Brettanomyces character would be classified as "American-style Brett Ale."A statement by the brewer that could include information such as style being elaborated upon, and other information about the entry with regard to flavor, aroma or appearance, is essential for fair assessment in competitions. Beers with Brettanomyces may be subcategorized under this category

breweries.name: Upland Brewing Company
breweries.description: We’ve been brewing ales, lagers, and sours in Bloomington, Indiana since 1998. Many of our brews are unique twists on traditional recipes, while others are products of our own imaginations. We’re proud to say that several of our beers have brought home national and international medals and awards, but what we really care about is brewing the kinds of beer we like to drink, and providing a fresh local option to our communities. It never hurts to get a pat on the back, though! Along the way, we’ve made lots of friends and drank our unfair share of good beer, all while trying to do good in our communities and do well as a craft brewery.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Upland offers free tours from 3-5 pm every Saturday and Sunday.

pen 11:00am until midnight Monday through Thursday
Open 11:00am until 1:00am Friday and Saturday

They are unique beers unto themselves. Notes of banana, berry, apple, sometimes coriander spice-like and/or smoky-phenolic characters should be portrayed with balance of hops and malt character when fermented with such yeast. Hop aroma, flavor and bitterness not usually found in the base style, can be medium to very high and must show the characters of American hop varieties. Beers with Brettanomyces may be subcategorized under this category

breweries.name: Brouwerij de Molen
breweries.description: Our brewery is world-famous for our large variety of (imperial) stouts, ales and smoked ales. We want to make good quality beer with respect for people and the environment.

breweries.name: Tired Hands Brewing Company
breweries.description:
We value local over imported, small batches over mass production, and striking a successful balance between giving back to our community and personal profit. Localization guides everything we do, from sourcing raw ingredients and materials, to employing area talent.

Tired Hands Brewing Company will operate at 16 Ardmore Avenue, Ardmore Pa, on a six barrel brewhouse. We will focus our brewing on two very broad styles of beers that hold a special place in my heart: Belgian/French farmhouse ales and American hop-forward ales.

All cheeses, meats, and seasonal produce served at our cafe (simple and satisfying fare from honest local producers) will be sourced from within 100 miles of our brewery.

name: Maillard's Odyssey - Beer Camp Across America
nameDisplay: Maillard's Odyssey - Beer Camp Across America (2014)
description:
Rich, dark, and roasty. That was the concept Bell’s beer guru John Mallett aimed for and, true to John’s vision, Maillard’s Odyssey is exactly that. Its name honors the Maillard reaction—the “browning” of sugars and amino acids—that creates the wonderful caramelized toffee-like and roasted flavors so abundant in this beer.

Bell’s has done a lot to raise the Midwest’s craft beer bona fides. They are masters of many beer styles from their portfolio of top-notch American stouts all the way through to the alpha acid assault of their Hopslam Ale. Bell’s constantly reinvents beer styles and refines recipes with artful mastery and an oddball slant.

style.name: Dark American-Belgo-Style Ale
style.description: These beers must portray the unique characters imparted by yeasts typically used in fruity and big Belgian-Style ales - These beers are not traditional Belgian styles which are already defined. They are unique beers unto themselves. Notes of banana, berry, apple, sometimes coriander spice-like and/or smoky-phenolic characters should be portrayed with balance of hops and malt character when fermented with such yeast. Hop aroma, flavor and bitterness not usually found in the base style, can be medium to very high and must show the characters of American hop varieties. Dark color falls in the deep amber/brown to black range. Roasted malts or barley may have a range of character from subtle to robust, and should be reflected in the overall character and balance of the beer. Esters should be at medium to high levels. Diacetyl should not be evident. Chill haze may be evident. Sulfurlike yeast character should be absent. No Brettanomyces character should be present. breweries.name: Bell's Brewery
breweries.description: Bell's Brewery began in 1985 with a quest for better beer and a 15 gallon soup kettle. Since then, we've grown into a regional craft brewery that employs more than 500 people over an 31 state area, in addition to Puerto Rico and Washington DC. The dedication to brewing flavorful, unfiltered, quality craft beers that started in 1985 is still with us today. We currently brew over 20 beers for distribution as well as many other small batch beers that are served at our pub in Kalamazoo, the Eccentric Cafe. 100% family-owned and independent, our ongoing goal is to brew thoughtfully, creatively and artistically. We strive to bring an authentic and pleasant experience to all of our customers through our unique ales and lagers.

breweries.name: Sierra Nevada Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The Sierra Nevada Brewing Company was established in 1980 by homebrewers Ken Grossman and Paul Camusi. Camusi retired in 1998 and sold his share in the company to Grossman.

Located in Chico, California, Sierra Nevada Brewing is one of the most popular craft breweries currently operating in the United States. Its Pale Ale is world renowned, and the brewery produces almost 700,000 barrels of beer per year. Sierra Nevada's Pale Ale is the second best-selling craft beer in the United States, behind the Boston Beer Company's Samuel Adams Boston Lager.

Sierra Nevada's specialty brews include the winter seasonal Celebration, which is similar to the pale ale, but hoppier; and Summerfest, a lager which is citrusy and sunny.

breweries.name: Solemn Oath Brewery
breweries.description: Debuting in 2012, Solemn Oath Brewery features an array of American, Belgo-American, traditional, wood-aged and experimental beer styles. We're excited to join our Illinois craft brethren in providing you with another quality-focused, local option to satisfy your craft beer needs.

name: Midnight Departure
description: This style combines the darkness of a Porter, with the hop-profile of an IPA, along with a hint of chocolate and roast. Brewed with Amarillo, Cascade, and Magnum hops.

available.name: Seasonal
available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.

style.name: Dark American-Belgo-Style Ale
style.description: These beers must portray the unique characters imparted by yeasts typically used in fruity and big Belgian-Style ales - These beers are not traditional Belgian styles which are already defined. They are unique beers unto themselves. Notes of banana, berry, apple, sometimes coriander spice-like and/or smoky-phenolic characters should be portrayed with balance of hops and malt character when fermented with such yeast. Hop aroma, flavor and bitterness not usually found in the base style, can be medium to very high and must show the characters of American hop varieties. Dark color falls in the deep amber/brown to black range. Roasted malts or barley may have a range of character from subtle to robust, and should be reflected in the overall character and balance of the beer. Esters should be at medium to high levels. Diacetyl should not be evident. Chill haze may be evident. Sulfurlike yeast character should be absent. No Brettanomyces character should be present. An ale which exhibits Brettanomyces character would be classified as "American-style Brett Ale."A statement by the brewer that could include information such as style being elaborated upon, and other information about the entry with regard to flavor, aroma or appearance, is essential for fair assessment in competitions. Beers with Brettanomyces may be subcategorized under this category

breweries.name: Airways Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Friendly service and tasty beer make us a favorite of locals as well as beer enthusiasts from all over. 

Special and seasonal beers make a frequent appearance. Our tap room has bar seating as well as small tables. On sunny days, garden seating is available.

Airways opened on March 4, 2010. Founder and brewer Alex Dittmar has had a lifelong passion for 60′s era jetliners. Airways is a combination of his love for airplanes, good beer, and a connection with people from all over the world.

name: Negura Bunget
description: The most metal beer ever brewed, our Transylvanian inspired Dark Ale, Negura Bunget! This beer is named after Negura Bunget, the best metal band to come out of Romania, and number 4 in our Art Can Series.

style.name: Dark American-Belgo-Style Ale
style.description: These beers must portray the unique characters imparted by yeasts typically used in fruity and big Belgian-Style ales - These beers are not traditional Belgian styles which are already defined. breweries.name: Southern Star Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Located in Conroe, Texas, Southern Star Brewing Company will provide Texans(and others) new craft beers to enjoy from our 10,000 square foot warehouse. 

Production began in March of 2008 with our signature beer of Pine Belt Pale Ale which is in our distinctive 16oz can or in kegs. This has now expanded to include Bombshell Blonde(12oz cans) and Buried Hatchet Stout(12oz cans), but both are also kegged. These will just be a few of the ales we will be offering as we expand into seasonal batches, plus we just started our PRO-AM line of brews where home brewers can compete to have their recipe produced at our brewery(with the help of the creators if they desire). The winning entry will also be entered into the GABF. 

Thanks to the help of our five distributors, we are able to get our brews to a variety of locations(including grocery stores, beverage shops, pubs and restaurants) throughout Texas and a few other states including Alabama, Florida, Indiana, Kentucky, Ohio, and South Carolina. Unfortunately due to laws in Texas we can't tell you where you can buy our beers, but we are working at trying to get them to as many of your favorite craft beer establishments as possible.

name: Obolon Oksamytove
description: Dark beer with a sweet flavor, full of pleasant aromas and the taste of caramel malt.
foodPairings: Goes well with sweet and spicy dishes.

style.name: Dark American-Belgo-Style Ale
style.description: These beers must portray the unique characters imparted by yeasts typically used in fruity and big Belgian-Style ales - These beers are not traditional Belgian styles which are already defined. breweries.name: Obolon Joint Stock Company
breweries.description:
The corporation’s history dates back to 1974 when the construction site of the future brewery was sand filled. The start-up of production was dedicated to the 1980 Olympic Games.

Czech experts were engaged in the project as world-renowned brewmasters. They were the ones who identified the construction site for the new brewery. The choice of construction site was determined by the main factor, namely the availability of huge reserves of soft, crystal-clear water. Today, the water from Jurassic bedrock (290 m) ensures the high quality of our products.

Soon afterwards, the enterprise gave the impetus to developing the largest corporation in Ukraine to produce beer, low alcohol and soft drinks, and mineral water.

The plant received its current name only in 1986, after the district of Kyiv with the same name. The word ‘Obolon’ comes from the times of Kievan Rus, when it denoted low riverside meadows.

Built according to a Czech design, the brewery produced beer that gained wide popularity. After Ukraine became independent, Obolon was the first corporation to export hopped beverages to Europe and the USA. Obolon trademark beer started being perceived as traditional Ukrainian beer in the whole world.

After a quarter of a century, Obolon has evolved into a world-renowned trademark. Today people on five continents associate Obolon with Ukrainian beer #1.

name: P.Y.T (Pretty Young Thing)
description: This might be the first Black APA possibly created. This has a more malty flavored brew compared our King of Hop because of the reduced hop presence. Dry hopped with Falconer’s Flight to give that roastiness something to compete with.

style.name: Dark American-Belgo-Style Ale
style.description: These beers must portray the unique characters imparted by yeasts typically used in fruity and big Belgian-Style ales - These beers are not traditional Belgian styles which are already defined. breweries.name: Union Brewing Company
breweries.description: At Union Brewing Company, our artisan ales are hand crafted two barrels at a time using time honored traditions, natural ingredients and traditional methods. Our beers are never filtered or force carbonated. They condition and carbonate naturally in casks and are hand drawn by authentic beer engines at the perfect drinking temperature to maximize all the flavors. (No, they are not warm!) We really like beer, and we love cask conditioned real ales. We think you will too!

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Mon - Thu: 4:00 pm - 11:00 pm
Fri: 3:00 pm - 1:00 am
Sat: 12:00 pm - 1:00 am
Sun: 12:00 pm - 9:00 pm

name: Perch Airing Of Grievances
description: A substantial, malty dark ale with a complex and flavorful roasted character.

breweries.name: The Perch Pub & Brewery
breweries.description: The Perch is something you have to see to believe. With panoramic views of Downtown Chandler on our roof top bar or our lush garden landscape in our courtyard that hosts over 90 tropical rescue birds. We have the most unique and breathtaking setting, and we feature 40 beers on tap, including our very own  house brews, and a full menu of beer-infused food created by our chef and his team of culinary masterminds. Anytime is the perfect time to treat yourself to an unforgettable experience at The Perch.

name: Pitched Blue
description: Navigate the cosmos and awaken your senses to fresh blueberry and biscuit malts with subtle, stimulating dark notes.

style.name: Dark American-Belgo-Style Ale

breweries.name: Empyrean Brewing Company
breweries.description: It began with a dream that we could brew full-flavored beer in the great state of Nebraska. In late 1990 that dream became our state’s first brewpub, Lazlo’s Brewery & Grill. Since then demand for our beer has grown, so we expanded our pub and Empyrean Brewing Company was born. Today we still dream big even while we hand craft our beers in small flavor–filled batches. So enjoy an Empyrean beer, the taste of dreams come true.
